revised_title: X-ray Investigation of Optically Anomalous Crystals of Racemic Potassium Chlorosulphoacetate
tldr: The authors investigated optically anomalous crystals of racemic potassium chlorosulphoacetate using X-ray diffraction. They found that the crystals are truly orthorhombic, and the optical anomalies can be explained by a slight difference in orientation of successively crystallized layers. The presence of alkali halides in the mother liquor may have caused strained lamellar growth.
